identificationModule.briefTitle: GBT021601-022: A Study of GBT021601 in Participants With Sickle Cell Disease (SCD)
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open-label Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety of GBT021601 Administered to Participants With Sickle Cell Disease Who Have Participated in a GBT021601 Clinical Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: An Open-label Extension Study of GBT021601 in Participants with Sickle Cell Disease
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: An Open-label Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of GBT021601 Administered to Participants with Sickle Cell Disease Who Have Participated in a GBT021601 Clinical Trial

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the incidence of SCD treatment-emergent adverse events with the daily dosing of GBT021601 in participants with sickle cell disease
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the effects of long-term use of GBT021601 on hemolytic anemia.
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in hematological laboratory parameters.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on inflammation
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in adhesion of whole blood to microfluidic channels.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on quality of life (QOL) assessments
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in QOL assessments including Patient Global Impression of Change (PGI-C).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in hemoglobin
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in hemoglobin of daily dosing of GBT021601 in participants with SCD
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the change from baseline in reticulocytes
primaryOutcomes.description: Change in reticulocytes from baseline of daily dosing of GBT021601 in participants with SCD
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on inflammation
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in adhesion of white blood cells to microfluidic channels.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on quality of life (QOL)
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in QOL assessments including Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGI-C).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on quality of life (QOL)
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in QOL assessments including Patient Global Impression of Severity (PGI-S).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the long-term effects of GBT021601 treatment on quality of life (QOL)
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in QOL assessments including Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate change from baseline in lactate dehydrogenase
primaryOutcomes.description: Changes in lactate dehydrogenase from baseline of daily dosing of GBT021601 in participants with SCD
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate change from baseline in unconjugated bilirubin
primaryOutcomes.description: Changes in unconjugated bilirubin from baseline of daily dosing of GBT021601 in participants with SCD
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetic parameters of long-term exposure to GBT021601
secondaryOutcomes.description: Trough and 1-to 2-hour post dose blood and plasma concentrations of GBT021601.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Outcome measures will be evaluated from time of enrollment every 12 weeks through end of treatment up to 4 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Male or female age 6 months or older with SCD who participated and received study drug or placebo in the previous GBT-Sponsored GBT021601 clinical study and remained on the previous study within 30 calendar days of the Day 1 visit for Study GBT021601-022.

   Note: Participants who discontinued study drug in the originating study due to an TEAE, but who remained on study, may be eligible for treatment in this study provided the TEAE does not pose a risk for treatment with GBT021601.
2. Female participants of childbearing potential are required to have a negative urine pregnancy test prior to dosing on Day 1.

   Note: Female participants who become of childbearing potential during the study must be willing to have negative urine pregnancy tests to remain in the study.
3. If sexually active, female participants of childbearing potential must consistently use highly effective methods of contraception consistently throughout the study and for at least 120 days after the last dose of study drug. If sexually active, male participants must use barrier methods of contraception until 120 days after the last dose of study drug.
4. Participant has provided written informed consent/assent. For underage participants, both the consent of the participant's legal representative or legal guardian and the participant's assent (where applicable) must be obtained based on local requirements.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participant withdrew consent or was noncompliant from the originating GBT021601 clinical study.

Current or recent use of voxelotor. Recent use is defined as within 10 days prior to Day 1.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
